image.altText: Ten high school aged students in casual dress sit in a classroom, with a female teacher speaking at the front.

props.synopsis: It's up to state and territory governments to fund media literacy programs in schools, and a 2023 study of young Australians found only one in four surveyed received a lesson teaching them how to work out if news stories are true in the past year.

title.children: 'It wasn't healthy': The program empowering teens to protect themselves from media disinformation

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: An email obtained by the ABC confirms Queanbeyan Hospital has stopped providing surgical terminations for fetal anomalies and medical reasons, restricting access to a legal and time-critical form of reproductive health care.

title.children: Emails shows Queanbeyan Hosptial banned surgical abortions, after woman turned away on day of appointment

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A jury in the trial of a NSW police officer accused of the manslaugher of great-grandmother Clare Nowland has been shown CCTV and police body-cam footage of her tasering, and told she weighed less than 50 kilograms after her death.

title.children: 95yo great-grandmother tasered by police officer in Cooma weighed 47.5kg at autopsy, court told

image.altText: A man wearing a white cap and a black shirt with the words"ACT suicide free by 2033".

props.synopsis: John Veloudos has achieved the feat of running 100km, after just three months of training.Â

title.children: John decided to run 100km after seeing the impact of mental illness

image.altText: Boy smiling with award in hand and medal around neck

props.synopsis: A coroner says wearing a life jacket may have increased 16-year-old Jack Bird's chances of survival when he was thrown from his boat into rough water on a lake near the Victorian-NSW border.

title.children: Teenage boy's drowning prompts call for stronger life jacket laws in NSW

image.altText: An auctionerr, facing away from the camera, facing towards a man and woman.

props.synopsis: There are more sellers than buyers in the Canberra property market, as a new report finds home values declined over the last three months.

title.children: Canberra home values are declining â but it's only a buyers' market for those who can save a deposit

image.altText: Lightning strikes nearby a house in suburban australia during a storm

props.synopsis: Thunderstorms and torrential rain have hit across Australia this week, with forecasts suggesting this weather could continue through this week and to the end of the year.

title.children: Torrential rain hits Australia's east coast, with climate drivers activating thunderstorm season

image.altText: Two young nurses in sunglasses hold cardboard posters protesting nurses pay rates

props.synopsis: On the eve of a 24-hour strike, nurses in NSW have lashed out against the state's government refusal to meet its demands for a pay rise, just a day after police received a historic wage increase.

title.children: NSW nurses to strike over low pay, days after police receive a historic wage offer

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: This year's Shonky Awards have been announced, with Facebook parent company Meta amongst the winners for its "inadequate action" against scams.

title.children: Five companies and products make the cut as CHOICE announces 19th annual Shonky Awards

image.altText: A man on a bike rides through the street with ruins of buildings behind him

props.synopsis: Some 50,000 Russian troops have reportedly moved to a region held by Ukraine since August, with experts saying it is no coincidence that the renewed interest coincides with the US presidential race and the re-election of Donald Trump.

title.children: Ukraine and Russia are fighting over a 'bargaining chip'. It could have implications for Donald Trump's peace plans

image.altText: A large truck carrying pallets of aid bundles through a dusty border crossing.

props.synopsis: The US will continue to provide military assistance to the Netanyahu government, despite aid agencies saying it has fallen short of providing enough aid to the wartorn region.

title.children: Aid agencies accuse Israel of failing to provide enough support to Gaza as US deadline passes

image.altText: A digital tablet is attached to a shopping trolley.

props.synopsis: Woolworths says it wants to roll out its smart shopping trolleys to more stores to help people budget their shops better. Smart carts overseas have helped increase the average customer spend by 6 per cent.

title.children: The tech company behind Woolworths 'smart' shopping trolleys says they could help you buy more impulsively

image.altText: A stressed-looking woman with short gray hair and maroon top sitting at a table with her head in her hand.

props.synopsis: First results of theÂ 2024 National Carers Survey show many carers feel socially isolated and suffer from high or very high levels of psychological distress.

title.children: 'I've pretty much given up.' Stressed and isolated carers say they can't get the support they need

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

props.synopsis: Advocacy groups have called for further reform of the Disability Support Pension and condemned the federal government for its response to a Senate inquiry into the payment.

title.children: Is the Disability Support Pension fit for purpose? Advocates say it needs a transformation

image.altText: A small child's hand is cupped by an old woman's hand

props.synopsis: One in three Australian grandparents babysit their grandkids to fill in gaps in childcare, becoming a support "village" for working parents, research finds. But what happens if you don't have grandparents to rely on?

title.children: One in three Aussie grandparents regularly babysit to fill in gaps in childcare, research finds

image.altText: A PsiQuantum cryogenic cabinet

props.synopsis: Australian governments have been the big spender on quantum technology, outcompeting private capital. But a change in Queensland's government has put a question mark over that spending.

title.children: Governments outspend private sector in quantum race, as Australia chases emerging tech

image.altText: Peter Dutton outdoors

props.synopsis: The opposition leader said he would need to look at the budget numbers before committing to any tax changes. Follow live.Â

title.children: Dutton won't commit to tax cuts for wealthy

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Listen to the PM's interview live
'I support a woman's right to choose': Dutton

image.altText: A composite image of the Rainbow Warrior, Rongelap Atoll and a nuclear explosion

props.synopsis: The Rainbow Warrior made headlines around the world when it was sunk by French operatives. But before that, its lesser-known last mission was to evacuate an entire island poisoned by nuclear testing in the Pacific.

title.children: US nuclear testing forced an entire island in the Pacific to evacuate â onboard a Greenpeace ship

image.altText: University students walk through campus, some looking at their phones. The photo is blurry, making faces unidentifiable.

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government moves to ease the debt burden in the HECS system, a different group of former students is demanding their debt be wiped.Â

title.children: 'Life sentence': The Keating government 'debt trap' Australians are still paying back

image.altText: A photo of the Shell company logo.

props.synopsis: Oil giant Shell wins a landmark case at The Hague, overturning an earlier court ruling ordering it to cut its carbon emissions by 45 per cent.Â

title.children: 'We are pleased': Oil giant Shell wins landmark climate case against green groups in Dutch appeal

image.altText: A man in a black suit and a yellow tie stands at a podium, addressing the press and gesturing to the crowd.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is moving aggressively to ready Labor for an early election campaign, flying to Tasmania to announce high-profile candidates for Braddon and Lyons.

title.children: Early election speculation reaches a fever pitch as Albanese announces two candidates in two hours

image.altText: Flowers outside a school

props.synopsis: Australia's leading injury prevention organisation says bollards, barriers, and rocks should be placed around schools and playgrounds to help stop vehicles crossing roadsides and footpaths.

title.children: Call for changes to infrastructure around schools after tragic deaths in Victoria

image.altText: A Korean woman with short hair sitting at desk wearing Kodak yellow fleece.

props.synopsis: The radical feminist 4B movement took root in a culture where women face domestic violence and insidious spy-cam sexploitation, as well as the "double burden" of work and family.

title.children: Women in the US are turning to the 4B movement post-Trump. But where did it all begin?

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: South Australia's state coroner will investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of Anthony Higgins, who went missing off the coast of Granite Island in September 2020.Â

title.children: Death of boatman Anthony Higgins, who went missing twice in one month, to be investigated

image.altText: Kelly Kay standing in front of the beach holding a framed photo of her son Kahi.

props.synopsis: Kahi Simon, 20, died by suicide five days after being discharged from hospital. His mother doesn't want any other parent to live her nightmare.

title.children: Kelly's 'kind and creative' son died days after being discharged from hospital

image.altText: Close up of man and woman seated next to each other with arms folded across their chests. Only arms and up to neck is visible.

props.synopsis: A divorce or separation is one of the hardest things some people will experience, but there are ways to try to make it as least distressing as possible.Â

title.children: Psychologists name the 'crucial' ingredients in a healthy relationship separation

image.altText: generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: ASIC says the financial loss to members could top $20 million and has launched legal action in the Federal Court seeking penalties and other compliance orders.

title.children: ASIC to take action against Cbus Super over delayed death and disability payments

image.altText: Sam Lalor poses for a photo at the draft combine holding a whiteboad with personal profile details on it

props.synopsis: With the AFL draft just around the corner, see which picks eachÂ club has to work with and theÂ players they couldÂ select.

title.children: AFL draft club by club: Every team's picks and potential targets

image.altText: A security person stands guard near a sports center where a man rammed a car into a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Local police describe the hit-and-run incident as a "vicious" and deliberate attack. They say the alleged 62-year-old driver was upset about his divorce.

title.children: 35 killed and 43 others injured in southern China after car deliberately ploughs into crowd

image.altText: Ten high school aged students in casual dress sit in a classroom, with a female teacher speaking at the front.

props.synopsis: It's up to state and territory governments to fund media literacy programs in schools, and a 2023 study of young Australians found only one in four surveyed received a lesson teaching them how to work out if news stories are true in the past year.

title.children: 'It wasn't healthy': The program empowering teens to protect themselves from media disinformation

image.altText: A collection of hearing aids held in composer Rebecca Bracewell's hands.

props.synopsis: Many 26- to 65-year-olds who "fell between the cracks" when it came to accessing government assistance have turned to Sarah Dockrell and her hearing aid bank.

title.children: Meet the Tasmanian woman providing hearing aids to those in need, free of charge

image.altText: A Rex aircraft seen through a window at an airport terminal, in the foreground inside are airport seats.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a bailout for Rex Airlines, while an ACCC report has revealed domestic airfares have risen since Rex's collapse.

title.children: Coldplay or price gouging? Regulators investigate why Australians are paying more for domestic flights

image.altText: Two players reach out and try to grab the ball

props.synopsis: Despite winning two international titles this year, the Australian men's netball team is making more headlines for its dance moves. That's after players copped backlash when a video of them copying Deadpool's NSYNC Bye Bye Bye went viral.

title.children: 'You can't compare it to the haka': Australian men's Fast5 captain hits back at homophobic comments
